item.title: CV
item.author: s.kleinebardenhorst@me.com (Sven Kleine Bardenhorst)
item.description: Sven Kleine Bardenhorst XX XXXXX 00 Utrecht Netherlands +49-170-1234567 s.bardenhorst@me.com Work experience 2018 (expected) Internship University Medical Center Utrecht, Laboratory for Translation Immunology (Utrecht) The aim of this internship under supervision by Dr. Julia Drylewicz is to identify novel biomarkers to differentiate active from latent tuberculosis infections by means of unsupervised classification algorithms. 2017-now Student Assistant, Utrecht University (Utrecht) As part of the research group on circular data modeling by Prof.

item.title: About me
item.author: s.kleinebardenhorst@me.com (Sven Kleine Bardenhorst)
item.description: Although I started my bachelor’s in Psychology, I developed a keen interest in statistics already in the first few months of my study. After focussing my bachelor’s as much on statistics as possible, including a bachelor’s thesis on multivariate methods, I started the master’s program Methodology and Statistics for the Behavioural, Biomedical and Social Sciences at Utrecht University. Despite my background in Psychology, I am specifically interested in biomedical statistics as it provides amazingly interesting data and great possibilities to collaborate with people from various backgrounds.
